location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'Howz Al Kishla Fao'. Photographer: Domnick Photo, Basrah

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:199 x 294 mmCondition:The image is in good condition though punctured partially four times along the lower edge and twice completely by a hole punching device, also along the lower edge.Foliation:‘154’Process:Silver gelatin print

mods.abstract: Genre/Subject Matter:This photograph shows a road cut through Shaikh Aḥmad's estates in Fao and the date gardens affected by the Basra port authorities’ widening of the roads.The road extends from the foreground to background at right while the date gardens are visible predominantly at left and partially at right.An Arab man stands left of centre, holding a palm frond of one of the trees. Two further men are climbing the same tree.Inscriptions:Recto, upper left, pen and pencil: ‘154; ‘15’Verso, upper left, in pencil: ‘HOWZ AL. KISHLA FAO’Lower left, ink stamp: ‘DOMNICK PHOTO BASRAH’
